key_events.description: Petrobras' Board approved the Business Plan 2026-2030, forecasting US$ 109 billion in total investments.
Petrobras forecasts peak oil production of 2.7 million bpd in 2028 and peak total production of 3.4 million boed in 2028 and 2029.
XP Investimentos maintains a buy recommendation with a price target of R$ 37/PETR4 (US$ 13.6/ADR), implying a potential upside of +17%.
Itaú BBA has a price target of R$ 43 for PETR4 at the end of 2026.
Petrobras has renewed and expanded contracts to sell oil to Indian state-owned refiners, potentially exceeding US$3 billion for up to 60 million barrels.
Petrobras' proved reserves reached 12.1 billion boe as of December 31, 2025.
JP Morgan has an overweight recommendation for Petrobras with a price target of R$ 44, highlighting consistent reserve additions.
BTG Pactual maintains a buy recommendation for Petrobras, seeing upside risks to their 15% dividend yield estimate for the next 12 months.

risk_factors: Debt concerns if oil prices fall below US$ 65.
Sensitivity of EBITDA, cash flow, and dividends to oil price variations (US$ 6.6 billion, US$ 3.8 billion, and US$ 1.7 billion respectively per US$ 10/bbl variation).

investment_thesis.bull_case: Petrobras' Business Plan 2026-2030 forecasts significant investments and production growth, supported by positive analyst ratings from XP Investimentos (R$ 37/PETR4), Itaú BBA (R$ 43/PETR4), and JP Morgan (R$ 44/PETR4). Increased reserves and oil sales agreements further strengthen the bullish outlook.
investment_thesis.bear_case: Concerns exist regarding Petrobras potentially surpassing the US$ 75 billion gross debt limit if oil prices fall below US$ 65. Sensitivity to oil price fluctuations could significantly impact EBITDA, cash flow, and dividends.

summary_markdown: Petrobras (PETR4) exhibits a bullish outlook based on its approved Business Plan 2026-2030, projecting US$ 109 billion in investments. Production is expected to peak at 2.7 million bpd of oil in 2028 and 3.4 million boed in 2028-2029. XP Investimentos has a buy recommendation with a price target of R$ 37/PETR4, while Itaú BBA targets R$ 43/PETR4 by the end of 2026. Petrobras has renewed oil sales contracts with Indian refineries, potentially exceeding US$3 billion. Proved reserves reached 12.1 billion boe as of December 31, 2025. JP Morgan has an overweight recommendation with a price target of R$ 44. BTG Pactual maintains a buy recommendation, estimating a 15% dividend yield. Risks include potential debt issues if oil prices drop below US$ 65 and sensitivity to oil price variations, impacting EBITDA (US$ 6.6 billion), cash flow (US$ 3.8 billion), and dividends (US$ 1.7 billion) per US$ 10/bbl variation.
